properties.name: error
properties.description: The most recent run-time error information.

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version number of the ExtendScript engine.

properties.name: build
properties.description: The ExtendScript build information.

properties.name: buildDate
properties.description: The ExtendScript build date.

properties.name: global
properties.description: A reference to the global object, which contains the JavaScript global namespace.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: The current stack trace.

properties.name: level
properties.description: The current debugging level, which enables or disables the JavaScript debugger.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Gets or sets low-level debug output flags.

properties.name: strict
properties.description: Sets or clears strict mode for object modification.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: Gets or sets the current locale.

properties.name: localize
properties.description: Set to true to enable the extended localization features of the built-in toString() method.

properties.name: decimalPoint
properties.description: The character used as the decimal point character in formatted numeric output.

properties.name: memCache
properties.description: The ExtendScript memory cache size, in bytes.

properties.name: screens
properties.description: An array of objects containing information about the display screens attached to your computer.

properties.name: os
properties.description: The current operating system version information.

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: The file name of the current script.

properties.name: line
properties.description: The current line number of the currently executing script.

properties.name: hiresTimer
properties.description:
A high-resolution timer, measuring the time in microseconds. The timer starts when ExtendScript is
						initialized during the application startup sequence. Every read access resets the timer to Zero.

properties.name: engineName
properties.description: The name of the current ExtendScript engine, if set.

properties.name: includePath
properties.description: The path for include files for the current script.

description: The $ object provides a number of debugging facilities and informational methods.
